add.s: Add a callback or a collection of callbacks to a callback list.

p.d: A function, or array of functions, that are to be added to the callback list.

addBack.s: Add the previous set of elements on the stack to the current set, optionally filtered by a selector.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match the current set of elements against.

addClass.s: Adds the specified class(es) to each of the set of matched elements.
addClass.y:
Add the class "selected" to the matched elements.
$( "p" ).last().addClass( "selected" );

p.d: One or more space-separated classes to be added to the class attribute of each matched element.

after.s: Insert content, specified by the parameter, after each element in the set of matched elements.
after.y: Inserts some HTML after all paragraphs. $( "p" ).after( "Hello" );

p.d: HTML string, DOM element, array of elements, or jQuery object to insert after each element in the set of matched elements.
One or more additional DOM elements, arrays of elements, HTML strings, or jQuery objects to insert after each element in the set of matched elements.

ajaxComplete.s: Register a handler to be called when Ajax requests complete. This is an AjaxEvent.

p.d: The function to be invoked.

ajaxError.s: Register a handler to be called when Ajax requests complete with an error. This is an Ajax Event.

p.d: The function to be invoked.

ajaxSend.s: Attach a function to be executed before an Ajax request is sent. This is an Ajax Event.

p.d: The function to be invoked.

ajaxStart.s: Register a handler to be called when the first Ajax request begins. This is an Ajax Event.

p.d: The function to be invoked.

ajaxStop.s: Register a handler to be called when all Ajax requests have completed. This is an Ajax Event.

p.d: The function to be invoked.

ajaxSuccess.s: Attach a function to be executed whenever an Ajax request completes successfully. This is an Ajax Event.

p.d: The function to be invoked.

andSelf.s: Add the previous set of elements on the stack to the current set.

animate.s: Perform a custom animation of a set of CSS properties.

p.d: An object of CSS properties and values that the animation will move toward.
A string or number determining how long the animation will run.
A string indicating which easing function to use for the transition.
A function to call once the animation is complete.

append.s: Insert content, specified by the parameter, to the end of each element in the set of matched elements.
append.y: Appends some HTML to all paragraphs. $( "p" ).append( "Hello" );

p.d: DOM element, array of elements, HTML string, or jQuery object to insert at the end of each element in the set of matched elements.
One or more additional DOM elements, arrays of elements, HTML strings, or jQuery objects to insert at the end of each element in the set of matched elements.

appendTo.s: Insert every element in the set of matched elements to the end of the target.

p.d: A selector, element, HTML string, array of elements, or jQuery object; the matched set of elements will be inserted at the end of the element(s) specified by this parameter.

attr.s: Get the value of an attribute for the first element in the set of matched elements or set one or more attributes for every matched element.

p.d: The name of the attribute to get.

before.s: Insert content, specified by the parameter, before each element in the set of matched elements.
before.y: Inserts some HTML before all paragraphs. $( "p" ).before( "Hello" );

p.d: HTML string, DOM element, array of elements, or jQuery object to insert before each element in the set of matched elements.
One or more additional DOM elements, arrays of elements, HTML strings, or jQuery objects to insert before each element in the set of matched elements.

bind.s: Attach a handler to an event for the elements.

p.d: A string containing one or more DOM event types, such as "click" or "submit," or custom event names.
An object containing data that will be passed to the event handler.
A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

blur.s: Bind an event handler to the "blur" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

change.s: Bind an event handler to the "change" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

children.s: Get the children of each element in the set of matched elements, optionally filtered by a selector.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

clearQueue.s: Remove from the queue all items that have not yet been run.

p.d: A string containing the name of the queue. Defaults to fx, the standard effects queue.

click.s: Bind an event handler to the "click" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

clone.s: Create a deep copy of the set of matched elements.

p.d: A Boolean indicating whether event handlers should be copied along with the elements. As of jQuery 1.4, element data will be copied as well.

closest.s: For each element in the set, get the first element that matches the selector by testing the element itself and traversing up through its ancestors in the DOM tree.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

contents.s: Get the children of each element in the set of matched elements, including text and comment nodes.

css.s: Get the value of a style property for the first element in the set of matched elements or set one or more CSS properties for every matched element.

p.d: A CSS property.

data.s: Store arbitrary data associated with the matched elements or return the value at the named data store for the first element in the set of matched elements.

p.d: A string naming the piece of data to set.
The new data value; it can be any Javascript type including Array or Object.

dblclick.s: Bind an event handler to the "dblclick" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

delay.s: Set a timer to delay execution of subsequent items in the queue.

p.d: An integer indicating the number of milliseconds to delay execution of the next item in the queue.
A string containing the name of the queue. Defaults to fx, the standard effects queue.

delegate.s: Attach a handler to one or more events for all elements that match the selector, now or in the future, based on a specific set of root elements.

p.d: A selector to filter the elements that trigger the event.
A string containing one or more space-separated JavaScript event types, such as "click" or "keydown," or custom event names.
A function to execute at the time the event is triggered.

dequeue.s: Execute the next function on the queue for the matched elements.

p.d: A string containing the name of the queue. Defaults to fx, the standard effects queue.

detach.s: Remove the set of matched elements from the DOM.

p.d: A selector expression that filters the set of matched elements to be removed.

die.s: Remove event handlers previously attached using .live() from the elements.
die.y:
To unbind all live events from all paragraphs, write:
$( "p" ).die();

each.s: Iterate over a jQuery object, executing a function for each matched element.

p.d: A function to execute for each matched element.

empty.s: Remove all of the callbacks from a list.

end.s: End the most recent filtering operation in the current chain and return the set of matched elements to its previous state.

eq.s: Reduce the set of matched elements to the one at the specified index.

p.d: An integer indicating the 0-based position of the element.

error.s: Bind an event handler to the "error" JavaScript event.

p.d: A function to execute when the event is triggered.

fadeIn.s: Display the matched elements by fading them to opaque.

p.d: A string or number determining how long the animation will run.
A function to call once the animation is complete.

fadeOut.s: Hide the matched elements by fading them to transparent.

p.d: A string or number determining how long the animation will run.
A function to call once the animation is complete.

fadeTo.s: Adjust the opacity of the matched elements.

p.d: A string or number determining how long the animation will run.
A number between 0 and 1 denoting the target opacity.
A function to call once the animation is complete.

fadeToggle.s: Display or hide the matched elements by animating their opacity.

p.d: A string or number determining how long the animation will run.
A string indicating which easing function to use for the transition.
A function to call once the animation is complete.

filter.s: Reduce the set of matched elements to those that match the selector or pass the function's test.
filter.y:
Change the color of all divs; then add a border to those with a "middle" class.
$( "div" )
  .css( "background", "#c8ebcc" )
  .filter( ".middle" )
    .css( "border-color", "red" );

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match the current set of elements against.

find.s: Get the descendants of each element in the current set of matched elements, filtered by a selector, jQuery object, or element.
find.y: Starts with all paragraphs and searches for descendant span elements, same as $( "p span" ) $( "p" ).find( "span" ).css( "color", "red" );

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

finish.s: Stop the currently-running animation, remove all queued animations, and complete all animations for the matched elements.

p.d: The name of the queue in which to stop animations.

first.s: Reduce the set of matched elements to the first in the set.

focus.s: Bind an event handler to the "focus" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

focusin.s: Bind an event handler to the "focusin" event.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

focusout.s: Bind an event handler to the "focusout" JavaScript event.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

get.s: Retrieve the DOM elements matched by the jQuery object.

p.d: A zero-based integer indicating which element to retrieve.

has.s: Determine whether a supplied callback is in a list

p.d: The callback to search for.

hasClass.s: Determine whether any of the matched elements are assigned the given class.

p.d: The class name to search for.

height.s: Get the current computed height for the first element in the set of matched elements or set the height of every matched element.

hover.s: Bind one or two handlers to the matched elements, to be executed when the mouse pointer enters and leaves the elements.

p.d: A function to execute when the mouse pointer enters the element.
A function to execute when the mouse pointer leaves the element.

html.s: Get the HTML contents of the first element in the set of matched elements or set the HTML contents of every matched element.

index.s: Search for a given element from among the matched elements.

innerHeight.s: Get the current computed height for the first element in the set of matched elements, including padding but not border.

innerWidth.s: Get the current computed width for the first element in the set of matched elements, including padding but not border.

insertAfter.s: Insert every element in the set of matched elements after the target.

p.d: A selector, element, array of elements, HTML string, or jQuery object; the matched set of elements will be inserted after the element(s) specified by this parameter.

insertBefore.s: Insert every element in the set of matched elements before the target.

p.d: A selector, element, array of elements, HTML string, or jQuery object; the matched set of elements will be inserted before the element(s) specified by this parameter.

is.s: Check the current matched set of elements against a selector, element, or jQuery object and return true if at least one of these elements matches the given arguments.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

jQuery.s: Return a collection of matched elements either found in the DOM based on passed argument(s) or created by passing an HTML string.
jQuery.y:
Find all p elements that are children of a div element and apply a border to them.
$( "div > p" ).css( "border", "1px solid gray" );

p.d: A string containing a selector expression
A DOM Element, Document, or jQuery to use as context

keydown.s: Bind an event handler to the "keydown" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

keypress.s: Bind an event handler to the "keypress" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

keyup.s: Bind an event handler to the "keyup" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

last.s: Reduce the set of matched elements to the final one in the set.

live.s: Attach an event handler for all elements which match the current selector, now and in the future.

p.d: A string containing a JavaScript event type, such as "click" or "keydown." As of jQuery 1.4 the string can contain multiple, space-separated event types or custom event names.
A function to execute at the time the event is triggered.

load-event.s: Bind an event handler to the "load" JavaScript event.

p.d: A function to execute when the event is triggered.

load.s: Load data from the server and place the returned HTML into the matched element.
load.y:
Load the main page's footer navigation into an ordered list.
$( "#new-nav" ).load( "/ #jq-footerNavigation li" );

p.d: A string containing the URL to which the request is sent.
A plain object or string that is sent to the server with the request.
A callback function that is executed when the request completes.

map.s: Pass each element in the current matched set through a function, producing a new jQuery object containing the return values.

p.d: A function object that will be invoked for each element in the current set.

mousedown.s: Bind an event handler to the "mousedown" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

mouseenter.s: Bind an event handler to be fired when the mouse enters an element, or trigger that handler on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

mouseleave.s: Bind an event handler to be fired when the mouse leaves an element, or trigger that handler on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

mousemove.s: Bind an event handler to the "mousemove" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

mouseout.s: Bind an event handler to the "mouseout" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

mouseover.s: Bind an event handler to the "mouseover" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

mouseup.s: Bind an event handler to the "mouseup" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

next.s: Get the immediately following sibling of each element in the set of matched elements. If a selector is provided, it retrieves the next sibling only if it matches that selector.
next.y:
Find the very next sibling of each disabled button and change its text "this button is disabled".
$( "button[disabled]" ).next().text( "this button is disabled" );

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

nextAll.s: Get all following siblings of each element in the set of matched elements, optionally filtered by a selector.
nextAll.y:
Locate all the divs after the first and give them a class.
$( "div:first" ).nextAll().addClass( "after" );

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

nextUntil.s: Get all following siblings of each element up to but not including the element matched by the selector, DOM node, or jQuery object passed.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to indicate where to stop matching following sibling elements.
A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

not.s: Remove elements from the set of matched elements.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.
One or more space-separated event types and optional namespaces, or just namespaces, such as "click", "keydown.myPlugin", or ".myPlugin".
A selector which should match the one originally passed to .on() when attaching event handlers.
A handler function previously attached for the event(s), or the special value false.

offset.s: Get the current coordinates of the first element, or set the coordinates of every element, in the set of matched elements, relative to the document.

offsetParent.s: Get the closest ancestor element that is positioned.

on.s: Attach an event handler function for one or more events to the selected elements.

p.d: One or more space-separated event types and optional namespaces, such as "click" or "keydown.myPlugin".
A selector string to filter the descendants of the selected elements that trigger the event. If the selector is null or omitted, the event is always triggered when it reaches the selected element.
Data to be passed to the handler in event.data when an event is triggered.
A function to execute when the event is triggered. The value false is also allowed as a shorthand for a function that simply does return false.

one.s: Attach a handler to an event for the elements. The handler is executed at most once per element per event type.

p.d: A string containing one or more JavaScript event types, such as "click" or "submit," or custom event names.
An object containing data that will be passed to the event handler.
A function to execute at the time the event is triggered.

outerHeight.s: Get the current computed height for the first element in the set of matched elements, including padding, border, and optionally margin. Returns a number (without "px") representation of the value or null if called on an empty set of elements.

p.d: A Boolean indicating whether to include the element's margin in the calculation.

outerWidth.s: Get the current computed width for the first element in the set of matched elements, including padding and border.

p.d: A Boolean indicating whether to include the element's margin in the calculation.

parent.s: Get the parent of each element in the current set of matched elements, optionally filtered by a selector.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

parents.s: Get the ancestors of each element in the current set of matched elements, optionally filtered by a selector.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

parentsUntil.s: Get the ancestors of each element in the current set of matched elements, up to but not including the element matched by the selector, DOM node, or jQuery object.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to indicate where to stop matching ancestor elements.
A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

position.s: Get the current coordinates of the first element in the set of matched elements, relative to the offset parent.

prepend.s: Insert content, specified by the parameter, to the beginning of each element in the set of matched elements.
prepend.y: Prepends some HTML to all paragraphs. $( "p" ).prepend( "Hello " );

p.d: DOM element, array of elements, HTML string, or jQuery object to insert at the beginning of each element in the set of matched elements.
One or more additional DOM elements, arrays of elements, HTML strings, or jQuery objects to insert at the beginning of each element in the set of matched elements.

prependTo.s: Insert every element in the set of matched elements to the beginning of the target.

p.d: A selector, element, HTML string, array of elements, or jQuery object; the matched set of elements will be inserted at the beginning of the element(s) specified by this parameter.

prev.s: Get the immediately preceding sibling of each element in the set of matched elements, optionally filtered by a selector.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

prevAll.s: Get all preceding siblings of each element in the set of matched elements, optionally filtered by a selector.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

prevUntil.s: Get all preceding siblings of each element up to but not including the element matched by the selector, DOM node, or jQuery object.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to indicate where to stop matching preceding sibling elements.
A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.
Object onto which the promise methods have to be attached

prop.s: Get the value of a property for the first element in the set of matched elements or set one or more properties for every matched element.

p.d: The name of the property to get.

pushStack.s: Add a collection of DOM elements onto the jQuery stack.

p.d: An array of elements to push onto the stack and make into a new jQuery object.

queue.s: Show or manipulate the queue of functions to be executed on the matched elements.

p.d: A string containing the name of the queue. Defaults to fx, the standard effects queue.

ready.s: Specify a function to execute when the DOM is fully loaded.

p.d: A function to execute after the DOM is ready.

remove.s: Remove a callback or a collection of callbacks from a callback list.

p.d: A function, or array of functions, that are to be removed from the callback list.

removeAttr.s: Remove an attribute from each element in the set of matched elements.

p.d: An attribute to remove; as of version 1.7, it can be a space-separated list of attributes.

removeClass.s: Remove a single class, multiple classes, or all classes from each element in the set of matched elements.
removeClass.y:
Remove the class 'blue' from the matched elements.
$( "p:even" ).removeClass( "blue" );

p.d: One or more space-separated classes to be removed from the class attribute of each matched element.

removeData.s: Remove a previously-stored piece of data.

p.d: A string naming the piece of data to delete.

removeProp.s: Remove a property for the set of matched elements.

p.d: The name of the property to remove.

replaceAll.s: Replace each target element with the set of matched elements.

p.d: A selector string, jQuery object, DOM element, or array of elements indicating which element(s) to replace.

replaceWith.s: Replace each element in the set of matched elements with the provided new content and return the set of elements that was removed.

p.d: The content to insert. May be an HTML string, DOM element, array of DOM elements, or jQuery object.

resize.s: Bind an event handler to the "resize" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

scroll.s: Bind an event handler to the "scroll" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

scrollLeft.s: Get the current horizontal position of the scroll bar for the first element in the set of matched elements or set the horizontal position of the scroll bar for every matched element.

scrollTop.s: Get the current vertical position of the scroll bar for the first element in the set of matched elements or set the vertical position of the scroll bar for every matched element.

select.s: Bind an event handler to the "select" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

serialize.s: Encode a set of form elements as a string for submission.

serializeArray.s: Encode a set of form elements as an array of names and values.

siblings.s: Get the siblings of each element in the set of matched elements, optionally filtered by a selector.

p.d: A string containing a selector expression to match elements against.

size.s: Return the number of elements in the jQuery object.

slice.s: Reduce the set of matched elements to a subset specified by a range of indices.

p.d: An integer indicating the 0-based position at which the elements begin to be selected. If negative, it indicates an offset from the end of the set.

An integer indicating the 0-based position at which the elements stop being selected. If negative, it indicates an offset from the end of the set. If omitted, the range continues until the end of the set.

slideDown.s: Display the matched elements with a sliding motion.

p.d: A string or number determining how long the animation will run.
A function to call once the animation is complete.

slideToggle.s: Display or hide the matched elements with a sliding motion.

p.d: A string or number determining how long the animation will run.
A function to call once the animation is complete.

slideUp.s: Hide the matched elements with a sliding motion.

p.d: A string or number determining how long the animation will run.
A function to call once the animation is complete.

stop.s: Stop the currently-running animation on the matched elements.

p.d: A Boolean indicating whether to remove queued animation as well. Defaults to false.
A Boolean indicating whether to complete the current animation immediately. Defaults to false.

submit.s: Bind an event handler to the "submit" JavaScript event, or trigger that event on an element.

p.d: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

text.s: Get the combined text contents of each element in the set of matched elements, including their descendants, or set the text contents of the matched elements.

toArray.s: Retrieve all the elements contained in the jQuery set, as an array.

toggle-event.s: Bind two or more handlers to the matched elements, to be executed on alternate clicks.

p.d: A function to execute every even time the element is clicked.
A function to execute every odd time the element is clicked.
Additional handlers to cycle through after clicks.

toggle.s: Display or hide the matched elements.

p.d: A string or number determining how long the animation will run.
A function to call once the animation is complete.

toggleClass.s: Add or remove one or more classes from each element in the set of matched elements, depending on either the class's presence or the value of the switch argument.

p.d: One or more class names (separated by spaces) to be toggled for each element in the matched set.

trigger.s: Execute all handlers and behaviors attached to the matched elements for the given event type.

p.d: A string containing a JavaScript event type, such as click or submit.
Additional parameters to pass along to the event handler.

triggerHandler.s: Execute all handlers attached to an element for an event.

p.d: A string containing a JavaScript event type, such as click or submit.
An array of additional parameters to pass along to the event handler.

unbind.s: Remove a previously-attached event handler from the elements.

p.d: A string containing a JavaScript event type, such as click or submit.
The function that is to be no longer executed.

undelegate.s: Remove a handler from the event for all elements which match the current selector, based upon a specific set of root elements.

unload.s: Bind an event handler to the "unload" JavaScript event.

p.d: A function to execute when the event is triggered.

unwrap.s: Remove the parents of the set of matched elements from the DOM, leaving the matched elements in their place.

val.s: Get the current value of the first element in the set of matched elements or set the value of every matched element.

width.s: Get the current computed width for the first element in the set of matched elements or set the width of every matched element.

wrap.s: Wrap an HTML structure around each element in the set of matched elements.
wrap.y:
Wrap a new div around all of the paragraphs. $( "p" ).wrap( "
" );

p.d: A selector, element, HTML string, or jQuery object specifying the structure to wrap around the matched elements.

wrapAll.s: Wrap an HTML structure around all elements in the set of matched elements.
wrapAll.y:
Wrap a new div around all of the paragraphs. $( "p" ).wrapAll( "
" );

p.d: A selector, element, HTML string, or jQuery object specifying the structure to wrap around the matched elements.

wrapInner.s: Wrap an HTML structure around the content of each element in the set of matched elements.
wrapInner.y: Selects all paragraphs and wraps a bold tag around each of its contents. $( "p" ).wrapInner( "" );

p.d: An HTML snippet, selector expression, jQuery object, or DOM element specifying the structure to wrap around the content of the matched elements.

disable.s: Disable a callback list from doing anything more.

disabled.s: Determine if the callbacks list has been disabled.

fire.s: Call all of the callbacks with the given arguments

p.d: The argument or list of arguments to pass back to the callback list.

fired.s: Determine if the callbacks have already been called at least once.

fireWith.s: Call all callbacks in a list with the given context and arguments.

p.d: A reference to the context in which the callbacks in the list should be fired.
An argument, or array of arguments, to pass to the callbacks in the list.

lock.s: Lock a callback list in its current state.

locked.s: Determine if the callbacks list has been locked.

always.s: Add handlers to be called when the Deferred object is either resolved or rejected.

p.d: A function, or array of functions, that is called when the Deferred is resolved or rejected.
Optional additional functions, or arrays of functions, that are called when the Deferred is resolved or rejected.

done.s: Add handlers to be called when the Deferred object is resolved.

p.d: A function, or array of functions, that are called when the Deferred is resolved.
Optional additional functions, or arrays of functions, that are called when the Deferred is resolved.

fail.s: Add handlers to be called when the Deferred object is rejected.

p.d: A function, or array of functions, that are called when the Deferred is rejected.
Optional additional functions, or arrays of functions, that are called when the Deferred is rejected.

isRejected.s: Determine whether a Deferred object has been rejected.

isResolved.s: Determine whether a Deferred object has been resolved.

notify.s: Call the progressCallbacks on a Deferred object with the given args.

p.d: Optional arguments that are passed to the progressCallbacks.

notifyWith.s: Call the progressCallbacks on a Deferred object with the given context and args.

p.d: Context passed to the progressCallbacks as the this object.
Optional arguments that are passed to the progressCallbacks.

pipe.s: Utility method to filter and/or chain Deferreds.

p.d: An optional function that is called when the Deferred is resolved.
An optional function that is called when the Deferred is rejected.

progress.s: Add handlers to be called when the Deferred object generates progress notifications.

p.d: A function, or array of functions, to be called when the Deferred generates progress notifications.

reject.s: Reject a Deferred object and call any failCallbacks with the given args.

p.d: Optional arguments that are passed to the failCallbacks.

rejectWith.s: Reject a Deferred object and call any failCallbacks with the given context and args.

p.d: Context passed to the failCallbacks as the this object.
An optional array of arguments that are passed to the failCallbacks.

resolve.s: Resolve a Deferred object and call any doneCallbacks with the given args.

p.d: Optional arguments that are passed to the doneCallbacks.

resolveWith.s: Resolve a Deferred object and call any doneCallbacks with the given context and args.

p.d: Context passed to the doneCallbacks as the this object.
An optional array of arguments that are passed to the doneCallbacks.

state.s: Determine the current state of a Deferred object.

then.s: Add handlers to be called when the Deferred object is resolved, rejected, or still in progress.

p.d: A function that is called when the Deferred is resolved.
An optional function that is called when the Deferred is rejected.
An optional function that is called when progress notifications are sent to the Deferred.
